subject: Productivity
title: Confirmation Bias
description: A micro-lesson that makes Confirmation Bias usable.

hook.text: You think your team will win. So you notice every good play and ignore every bad one.

buildup.text: Confirmation bias means seeking information that supports what you already believe.

discovery.text: Peter Wason demonstrated this in 1960. People test hypotheses by looking for confirming evidence only.

twist.text: The bias strengthens with emotional investment. The more you care, the blinder you become.

climax.text: Actively seeking disconfirming evidence is the most effective antidote. Ask: what would prove me wrong?

punchline.text: We don't search for truth. We search for agreement.

quiz.question: What is confirmation bias?
options: Seeking information that supports existing beliefs
Changing beliefs based on new evidence
